ratings.comment: This class was VERY interesting, and I learned a lot. Prof. Baumgart is very funny and it was an enjoyable class. However, the tests have a lot of trick questions (choose the "best"), and my TA (who grades the papers) was really awful and gave no feedback. It's a cool class, but I wouldn't recommend for an easy A ethnic studies course.

Zach was an awesome instructor. I learned so much in his class and the content is so interesting I could listen to him talk about it for hours. Overall the class isn't that difficult. 3 exams and 3 short papers. Would highly recommend this class.

This was my favorite class all semester (and the only one I never skipped!) I've never been more interested/learned so much about a subject my entire life! Zach will truly be missed! He always sought to promote discussion in lecture, and presented the material in an interesting way, with many stats and examples to back up his claims. Very woke too!
Professor Baumgart is a great teacher. I have learned a lot from him. He also is a hot tamale with extra spice! I zone out sometimes in class just looking at him.
Read the assigned material, go to every lecture, and you will get a great grade

Exams were pretty fair, make sure you read the confusing topics in lecture in the book. My biggest complaint were the 3 short papers, in which they were biasly graded based on what point of view you expressed. Barely got an AB while acing every exam.

He was a good lecturer and kept everyone's attention. Exams were poorly written, you could know the concept clearly but get a question about it wrong. Papers were not graded fairly, the rubric given to us was different from the one that was used to grade every paper that semester, setting us up for failure.

Not a bad choice for fulfilling ethnic studies, considering its a 4 credit intermediate level class. Although some seemed to struggle, I found the material pretty easy. If you read the book before hand, lecture just becomes a review for the important concepts. 3 short papers and 3 non-cumulative multiple choice exams.

Absolutely loved the textbook for this class. Most of those who are complaining about tests being difficult either a) did not come to lecture or b) did not read the assigned readings. That being said, come to the class you're paying so much to take and read what you're supposed to. Expectations are clear. Great course. Wish everyone had to take it.

Do not take Soc 134 with Professor Baumgart. He is very arrogant and thinks he is better than everyone else. He is very disorganized and goes over information in lecture way too fast. For the final exam he told us we would have the full 2 hours to take it but then at the exam he only let us have 50 minutes to take it.

The class is pretty easy. 3 short papers and 3 non-cumulative tests. Attendance is not mandatory, but probably necessary to do well. Reading the textbook helps a lot. He seems kind of arrogant, but lectures are entertaining. Overall pretty easy.

One of the best classes I've had this semester. Professor Baumgart is hilarious and makes class fun. 3 tests and 3 papers. Tests are multiple choice. Read the book and go to lecture and you should do fine. Lecture isn't mandatory, but probably necessary. He doesn't post all the slides online. Overall, not the worst class I've taken.

It's obvious that Zach is new but he's learning. The class is very interesting and pretty easy. Read the book it really helps understand what is said in lecture. I don't know why this is a 4 credit course, I spend more time studying for my 3 credit classes.

Professor was very strict and midterms were brutal, but Zach made the class not only understandable but engaging. Very approachable, clear, and smart. He's simply brilliant! Zach has a natural talent at making complex systems and ideas easily digestible. He also has a knack for getting students involved which helps make discussions amazing!

I was originally dreading this class, however, Zach made it really manageable. Although the information is dry, he makes it as understandable and interesting as possible. Also, rather than writing a huge research at the end, we had a poster presentation of our research, which was much more interesting and fun than a tedious paper. Great professor!!
